intro: Aizoon spathulatum, commonly known as the broadleaf hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Aizoon spathulatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
